titleStmt.title: James W. Wallace et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9394

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
B Magoffin Govr of Ky

The undersigned Citizens of Union County would respectfully ask your Excellency to grant a Pardon to Vincent Shields now confined in the Penitentiary of the state under sentence of the Union Circuit Court
Vincent Shields is an old man has a family of Eight Children five or six of whom are quite young and in very limited Circumstances, requiring the care and attention of some one
We have also learned that he has become afflicted since his Confinement, and in all probability will not live until the expiration of his sentence. --
We therefore request that you grant him a pardon

Names
Jas W Wallace
John..S.. Watson
J C Wallace
John Conroy
Allen Wilson

Benj W. Crake
